- **High-Temperature, Short-Time (HTST) pasteurization**: Milk is heated to **72°C (161°F) for at least 15 seconds**, then rapidly cooled.
- **Ultra-High Temperature (UHT) pasteurization**: Milk is heated to **135°C (275°F) for at least 1 second**, then cooled. This allows for **longer shelf life** (up to several months) without refrigeration.
